title.narrative: EQUITABLE ACCESS TO JUSTICE

description.narrative: Strengthened administrative data, improved child-sensitive judicial procedures, quality legal aid and capacities of justice and law- enforcement professionals ensure that boys and girls in contact with the justice system receive fair, timely and effective services and remedies when their rights are violated., which contributes to Access To Justice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, social services, the child protection system and the administration of justice more effectively prevent violence, protect child victims and ensure access to timely remedy to child participants in judicial procedures, including in humanitarian situations

mailing-address.narrative: 87 A. Doundukov Blvd. Fl.2 Sofia 1504 Bulgaria P.O. Box 801

sector.narrative: Access to child-friendly and gender-responsive justice processes and procedures
Justice, law and order policy, planning and administration
Promoting diversion and alternatives to deprivation of liberty
Research, evaluation and other evidence generation and use - Justice

related-activity.ref: 0570/A0/05/003 PREVENTION OF VIOLENCE AND ACCESS TO JUSTICE

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened administrative data, improved child-sensitive judicial procedures, quality legal aid and capacities of justice and law-enforcement professionals ensure that boys and girls in contact with the justice system receive fair, timely and effective servicesand remedies when their rights are violated.

description.narrative: UNICEF with its partners reached4,086 children at risk/victims of violence;and provided them with;protective measures.UNICEF has continued advocating for legal reform and effective implementation of child-friendly policies and programmes in-country. The CO has also contributed to building the capacity of the Network for Legal Aid at theNational Network for Children to provide strategic litigation and advocate for effective A2J for vulnerable children and parents. It is expected that;the signed MoU with the Ministry of Interior will further strengthen the cooperation and impact of ongoing interventions on children at risk and in contact with the law. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:11/01/2022

title.narrative: Number of girls and boys participants in legal proceedings who benefit from specialized legal aid, Number

Data on the number of children participating in justice processes (criminal, civil, administrative), and the reasons for their participation is: a. Integrated into existing data collection and management mechanisms b. Disaggregated by age and gender c. Re, Text

baseline.value: Data is regularly collected and publicized

target.value: 2022:Data is integrated, disaggregated, regularly colleacted and publicized

title.narrative: Existence of procedures and services for children in contact with law that are applied and delivered in line with international norms (23-03-L3-03), Text

baseline.value: Some services and procedures exist but they are not fully developed, applied and delivered in line with international norms

target.value: 2022:Procedures for diversion in compliance with international norms are implemented
